program_name: Rural Decentralized Water Systems Grant Program
program_purpose_1: Helps qualified nonprofits create a revolving loan fund
program_purpose_2: Issue subgrants to improve access to safe, reliable drinking water in rural areas
program_purpose_3: Improve sanitary conditions caused by inadequate or failing septic systems
eligible_area_description: Rural areas and towns with populations of 50,000 or fewer, including tribal lands in rural areas and colonias
who_can_apply_criteria_1: Private nonprofits with expertise and experience promoting the safe, productive use of individually-owned household water well systems or decentralized wastewater systems
who_can_apply_criteria_2: Private nonprofits with legal authority to act as a lender
who_can_apply_criteria_3: Private nonprofits with sufficient expertise and experience in conducting and managing lending activities
who_can_apply_criteria_4: Private nonprofits with financial, technical, and managerial ability to comply with relevant federal and state laws and regulations
matching_funds_source: Nonprofit applicant or an eligible third party
how_grant_funds_can_be_used_3: Build, refurbish, or service individually-owned household water well and decentralized wastewater systems (e.g., septic system)
how_grant_funds_can_be_used_4: Complete work within the residence to address documented ground well water contamination
how_to_get_started_contact_office: Your local USDA Rural Development office
governing_regulation_2_name: Section 306E of the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act
note_usda_equal_opportunity_statement: USDA is an equal opportunity provider, employer, and lender
